result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerard M Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gerard M Washington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gerard M Washington was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine of $1,000.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge to be paid by 08-13-17 or serve 25 consecutive days in HOC.

COURT WILL CONSIDER MOTION FOR EXPUNGEMENT IF DEFENDANT PAYS THE FINE AND COSTS AFTER SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THE SENTENCE.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; No Huber privileges; Sentence to commence on 09-14-15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerard M Washington

records.addlTxt: Commitment Order for Non-Payment of Fine/ Forfeiture returned undeliverable by USPS.

Fine and Cost Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
25  days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court had ordered the sentence to commence on 9-14-15. Judgment of conviction should be amended to reflect the stay date. lr

Defendant Gerard M Washington in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT ONE:  

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve TWO MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3  days time served.  NO Huber privileges.

Fine of $1000.00  including all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge to be paid by 8-13-17 or serve 25 CONSECUTIVE days in the House of Correction.

Defendant to provide DNA sample

 Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs after  successfully completeing the sentence. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Gerard M Washington in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gerard M Washington in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gerard M Washington in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Gerard M Washington in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
